describe: Moldova, officially known as the Republic of Moldova, is a landlocked country in Eastern Europe, bordered by Romania to the west and Ukraine to the north, east, and south. Known for its rich cultural heritage, Moldova boasts a diverse landscape of rolling hills, vineyards, and historic sites.

cities.name: 🏙 Chișinău
cities.geographical_location: Located in the central part of the country, Chișinău is the capital and largest city of Moldova.
cities.climate: Chișinău experiences a humid continental climate with warm summers and cold, snowy winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Mămăligă, Plăcintă, and Sarmale are some of the famous local dishes.
popular_attractions: National Museum of History of Moldova

cities.name: 🏙 Tiraspol
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the eastern bank of the Dniester River, Tiraspol is the capital of the unrecognized Transnistria region.
cities.climate: Tiraspol has a humid continental climate with hot summers and cold winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Borscht, Pelmeni, and Kvass are popular in Tiraspol.

cities.name: 🏙 Bălți
cities.geographical_location: Located in the north of Moldova, Bălți is the third-largest city in the country.
cities.climate: Bălți experiences a humid continental climate with warm summers and cold winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Zeama, Mititei, and Colțunași are well-known dishes.
